text:
When integrating Ant into another project (as e.g. done in Fop, Cocoon etc.), jars used in that framework are usually located in the same directory as the Ant Jars. The construction of the LOCALCLASSPATH under Ant is unpredictiple (the order of jars loaded), which can lead to unexpected results. In my case the Saxon 6.4.4 XSLT processor jar is sometimes loaded before crimson and/or jaxp, which halts Ant with the message:



BUILD FAILED



The AElfred parser is a SAX2 XMLReader.



AElfred is the non validating parser included with Saxon.
creator: js@nw3.dk

text:
What you say is true but there isn't much to be done about that. Where you have
specific order requirements, I would suggest remving the jars from Ant's lib
directory to another area and then defining the CLASSPATH variable with the
explicit order you require.
creator: conor@apache.org
